poem:
Title: "In the Cradle of Politics"

In the hallowed halls of power,
Vexed voices whisper, plot and glower,
Two strong plotters remain in the shadow, 
Their ambitions, cryptic, like the deep furrow. 

"I dwell not in politics," declares Sunak,
Eyes on tomorrow, not on the flak.
Yet the heart of the party seems torn,
Before the morning of May's dawn.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Only ‘one or two’ Tory MPs plotting against Sunak, says Badenoch Reports of Conservative plots against Rishi Sunak are the work of just “one or two” MPs and the party needs to unite before May’s local elections, Kemi Badenoch, the business secretary, has said. Speaking later at a business event, Sunak dismissed talk of a threat to his leadership, saying: “I’m not interested in all Westminster politics. It doesn’t matter. What matters is the future". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
